contentrichtext.text: {{otherships|USS Davis }} {|{{Infobox Ship Begin}} {{Infobox Ship Image |Ship image=[[Image:USS Davis (DD-937) refuel.jpg|300px|USS Davis (DD-937)]] |Ship caption= }} {{Infobox Ship Career |Hide header= |Ship country=US |Ship flag={{USN flag|1983}} |Ship name= |Ship namesake=[[George Fleming Davis]] |Ship ordered=3 February 1954 |Ship builder=[[Bethlehem Steel]], [[Fore River Shipyard]] |Ship laid down=1 February 1955 |Ship launched=28 March 1956 |Ship acquired=28 February 1957 |Ship commissioned=28 February 1957 |Ship decommissioned=20 December 1982 |Ship in service= |Ship out of service= |Ship struck=27 July 1990 |Ship reinstated= |Ship honours= |Ship fate=Scrapped |Ship status= |Ship motto=''Vigilantia Pro Pacem'' |Ship notes= }} {{Infobox Ship Characteristics |Hide header= |Header caption= |Ship class=[[Forrest Sherman class destroyer]] |Ship displacement=4000 tons(full load) |Ship length=418' (127.4 m) |Ship beam=45' (13.7 m) |Ship draught= |Ship draft=21' (6.4 m) |Ship propulsion=Steam Turbine-70,000 h.p (52,2 MW) (4 - boilers burning DFM) |Ship speed=32 kts (59.3 km/h) (+) |Ship range=Excess of 2,000 n.m. (3,700 km) |Ship complement=18 Officers 290 Enlisted |Ship sensors= |Ship EW= |Ship armament=Two [[5"/54 caliber Mark 42 gun|5"54 (127 mm/54) caliber Gun mounts]];[[Hedgehog (weapon)|ASW Rockets]], Homing Torpedoes |Ship armour= |Ship armor= |Ship aircraft= |Ship aircraft facilities= |Ship notes= }} |} '''USS ''Davis'' (DD-937)''', named for Commander [[George Fleming Davis]] USN (1911-1945), commanding officer of [[USS Walke (DD-723)|USS ''Walke'' (DD-723)]], killed in action at [[Lingayen Gulf]] on [[Luzon]] in the [[Philippine Islands]] on 6 January 1945 and posthumously awarded the [[Medal of Honor]], was a [[Forrest Sherman class destroyer]] of the [[United States Navy]] laid down by the Bethlehem Steel Corporation at [[Quincy, Massachusetts]] on 1 February 1955, launched on 28 March 1956 by Mrs. G. F. Davis, widow of Commander Davis and commissioned on 28 February 1957. ==Fate== USS ''Davis'' was decommissioned on 20 December 1982, stricken from the [[Naval Vessel Register]] on 27 July 1990 and sold for scrap to the Fore River Shipyard and Iron Works at Quincy, Massachusetts on 11 December 1992. When the [[Fore River Shipyard]] went bankrupt she was resold to N. R. Acquisition Incorporated of [[New York City]] by the Massachusetts Bankruptcy Court and scrapped by Wilmington Resources of [[Wilmington, North Carolina|Wilmington]] in [[North Carolina]]. ==See also== *[[List of United States Navy destroyers]] ==References== *{{DANFS|http://www.history.navy.mil/danfs/d2/davis-iv.htm}} *{{NVR|http://www.nvr.navy.mil/nvrships/details/DD937.htm}} {{Forrest_Sherman_class_destroyer}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Davis (DD-937)}} [[Category:Forrest Sherman-class destroyers]] [[Category:Cold War destroyers of the United States]] [[Category:Vietnam War destroyers of the United States]] [[Category:Ships built in Massachusetts]] [[Category:1956 ships]]
